name: prance
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I + adv/prep ] to walk in an energetic way and with more movement than necessary: It's pathetic to see 50-year-old rock stars prancing around on stage as if they were still teenagers. She pranced into the office and demanded to speak to the manager.
[ I ] When a horse prances, it takes small, quick steps and raises its legs higher than usual.

Add to word list
Add to word list
to walk or dance in an energetic way, with high, kicking steps: In the square dance, each couple took turns prancing together under the linked arms of the other couples.
